name: G-Plan Nest of Tables
description:
We are very proud to present this beautiful nest of 3 tables made by G-Plan and they have been lovingly restored by our own fair hands.

The original varnish has been sanded down to the beautiful solid Teak wood finish and then given 3 coats of Danish Oil to bring the grain out and give it a delicious dark tone. The main table also has its original tiled top and they are in mint condition. All in all a beautiful piece.

Please do have a chat with us about couriers or arranging collection.

name: "Form 1000" mocha set for 4 by Bremer & Schmidt, Eisenberger Porzellan
description:
We are so absolutely in awe with this! 

Bremer & Schmidt, Eisenberger Porzellan porcelain manufacturers in Thuringia in the former GDR launched this design - they called it "Form 1000" (Shape 1000) - in 1955. From there on, it became one of the most wanted mocha sets in the country and was taken up by many other manufacturers (there is a dispute as to whether the others bought the blank parts and patterned them themselves). In any case, ours is from the original makers and we can completely understand why it was so popular!

This mocha set is for 4, with one spare cup and spare saucer (in case you break one). Or for 5 if you like uneven numbers. 

It comprises the mocha pot, 5 cups, 5 saucers, a milk jug and a sugar pot. 

It is in perfect condition. And now, we will let the images speak for themselves!

name: Drawer Shelf - "Darts Drawer-Board"
description:
The latest Drawer creation could be used in various ways but we think it would be great on your wall just next to the dart board.

In the series of pieces that give new life to chestless drawers this is a lovely old sock drawer (we have written a little history for each piece which comes with it) (they're not essentially true but they are entertaining) which has been reworked into a lovely shelf. The inside has been painted with high quality green blackboard paint so it is ideal to use as a darts score board as you can keep your darts, chalk and cloth in there too ;) but you can do with it as you please. As long as you treasure it and show it that you care.

We can send this to you but please speak to us first so that we can quote you the correct postage.

name: Le Mans Classic Photographic Book
description:
Very very excited about this. Currently we are the only people in the UK from which you can buy this wonderful Photographic celebration of The Le Mans Classic in the form of a soft cover coffee table book.

Every two years lovers of vintage cars gather to celebrate the greatest test of endurance, honour and valour known to 4 wheels. Over 24 hours cars from 1923 right through to 1979 race for the titles for their respective eras. This book features over 100 images in Black and White and Colour from The Pits and The Paddock celebrating the cars and the people that keep the dream alive.

This is an independent publication and accompanies Jon Mortimer's exhibition in March of next year.

name: G. Rossbach Spechtsbrunn black porcelain vase
description:
This vase was made by G. Rossbach Spechtsbrunn porcelain manufacturers in Thuringia in the 1950s/60s. 

It is black and is adorned with handpainted flowers. 

It has a few scratches which I have tried to show in the last image but in my opinion these don't take away from the overall beauty of this vase. 

The vase is roughly 20cm high.

name: Black vintage vase GDR
description:
This black vase with white flowers and white handle was made in the 1960s in the former GDR too. 

The surface of this one isn't as smooth as for the others (I tried to capture this in the image). Despite the unevenness, we still believe it deserves a new good home. 

It is approximately 22.5cm tall.

name: Green vintage vase GDR
description:
And yet another really pretty vase from the former GDR. 

This one is green, has white flowers and a handle and is roughly 22cm in height (it's in good condition too). 

We couldn't find a stamp or any information of its makers but we think it was made in the former GDR in the 1960s.

name: Polaroid SX70 Sonar camera 1970s
description:
We are so pleased with this design classic that we have just sourced and placed on our shelves. A beautiful example in Black Leather and in A1 condition. A few marks of wear on the black leather as this is 40 years old but no tears and the leather has not come unstuck at all. One of the best we have seen.
This particular one is a Sonar AF camera and very hard to find in any condition never mind this good. All works and looks wonderful. Even more exciting is that it comes with a Black original Polaroid case and a shoulder strap for the camera itself.
A real treat of 1970s design and now film is being made for it again by the magnificent people at Impossible Project. Lovely.

name: Milk jug by Kahla
description:
Such a happy design on this little milk jug by Kahla, Thuringia (former GDR). 

The stamp on the bottom of the jug indicates that it was made between 1957 and 1964. 

It is about 9cm in height and has no signs of damage.

name: Cold War Vintage Cinema seats from Russian cinema in East Berlin
description:
These beautiful cinema seats are from a Russian Cinema in East Berlin and date back to the 1960s when the cold war was at its height. 

Beautiful condition and comprise of 3 seats joined together. The top bar that holds the row together is missing but it takes nothing away from these beautifully made cinema seats.
The upholstery is in a green velvet texture and has no rips or tears and then there are the brilliantly mad buttons on every arm. Above the buttons you have a plug for your head phones, then below that a dial to control the volume. The four buttons themselves were where you would choose which language to have the film dubbed into through your head phones. Amazing.

Please enquire about courier costs as these are heavy little chaps.

name: Lippelsdorf mint green porcelain vase
description:
Another great vase from the good people of the VEB Lippelsdorf in the former GDR. 

The vase is about 18cm tall and has a pretty flowery pattern on one side which integrates well with the overall mint green shade of the vase. 

This one sadly has a little chip (please see image). Apart from that, it's in good nick. 

We believe this vase to be from the late 60s/early 70s and no later than 1974.

name: Drawer of Ideas
description:
This is part of the "Chestless Drawers" range where we find unloved drawers and bring them back to life in new roles.

Here we have The Drawer of Ideas. A vintage drawer customised into a shelf unit for your wall within which you can display some of your favourite things. It has been painted in high quality BLUE blackboard paint so that you can also cover it with your ideas, thoughts or quotes that inspire you.

This drawer comes with a story about its past life and is fitted with brass picture hangers so is ready to attached to your wall.

If you would like this delivered please do speak to us and we will give you a postage quote.

name: Glass vase
description:
Stylish vintage hand blown glass vase with no signs of damage in warm brownish-orange shade. 

It measure roughly 23cm in height.

name: Earthenware vase made by Geokeramik
description:
This stunning vase was made by Geokeramik in the 1960s in the former GDR. 

The vase is an orange-brown clay colour and has vertical white and black stripes. It is approximately 29cm in height and in good condition.

name: Elegant beige vintage vase
description:
This is a very elegant vase in shades of beige with darker horizontal stripes and a blue bottom. 

It has a convenient handle and is about 32cm in height. 

The vase was made in the former GDR and is in great condition

name: Wallendorf GDR most unusually shaped vase
description:
This vase has one of the most unique shapes I've seen around. It almost looks a bit futuristic when you consider that it was made by Wallendorfer Porzellan in the former GDR in the 1960s. 

It has a hair-line crack at the top which I tried to capture in one of the images. This is cosmetic though and would not impair the usage as a vase. 

It stands about 16cm tall.

name: Reinhold Vogt Graefenroda porcelain vase
description:
This is one of my new favourites: a 12cm tall curvaceous procelain vase made by Reinhold Vogt Graefenroda porcelain manufacturers in Thuringia in the former GDR in the 1950s/60s. 

It has a lovely, lovely design and a slight mother of pearl sheen around its bottom. 

No chips, cracks or crazing.

name: Lippelsdorf yellow porcelain vase
description:
Another fine example from the Lippelsdorf porcelain factory in the former GDR. 

This is a yellow porcelain vase in good condition without handle featuring a really pretty blue design. The vase is about 17cm tall. 

We believe this design to have been produced in the 1970s.

name: Enamel pot
description:
Cute enamel pot with sunflower motif. It's 9cm high and has a diameter of 15cm. 

You can see some Cyrillic letters on the stamp but we haven't been able to get the bottom of it. All we know is that it's adorable and that it was made in the 60s or 70s. And that it has no big signs of usage. 

We have two so please ask us if you are interested in more than one. Price shown is for one.

name: Lippelsdorf burgundy porcelain vase
description:
This is such a gorgeous vase. It was manufactured in the former GDR by VEB (nationally owned company) Porzellanfiguren (porcelain figurines) Lippelsdorf in Thuringia. The stamp at the bottom of the vase hints to the manufacture date being between 1951 and 1974 but I think you will agree that it looks very 1950s/60s. 

The shade is burgundy and it showcases pretty white flowers. The vase is roughly 22cm tall (to the highest point). 

I was not able to find any signs of damage.

name: Set of 4 lovely earthenware cups
description:
This is a set of 4 earthenware cups (about 9cm tall each) in lovely warm shades of orange and red. 

The cups have hand-painted flowers on them, two different designs on the back and on the front. 

The only signs of age I could find is wear around the rim (please see photos).

name: Beautifully eccentric cinema screen in a box
description:
This is one of Mr More Timer's favourite pieces. What more could you desire than a cinema screen in a box that you can carry around with you from east wing to west wing? It is quite simply a magnificent invention. And what a beautiful box too, not all shiny and plastic, oh no, this is a majestic wooden box with the markings of all of its adventures. Like a treasure chest ready to reflect the finest cinema can offer - whether it'd be from dvd or super 8 projector.

More pics are available if required. This is a rare treat for all lovers of the silver screen (well, white in this case).

Please enquire before ordering about delivery rates as this is a substantial piece and may not fit through your letter box.

name: G-Plan teak Fresco dressing table
description:
This, to me, is one of the most iconic G-Plan designs that were produced back in the day: a solid teak dressing table from the Fresco range. 

This particular model is in mint condition. It measures 70cm (height) x 153cm (width) x 50cm (depth). 

It will come with an attachable mirror (sorry, no pics but mirror WILL be there and is in good condition too) and the height would be 120cm with the mirror attached. 

This piece can be used either as a dressing table, or even as a desk. 

It has four regular drawers featuring the G-Plan handles that are the trademark of the red stamp Fresco range and one "hidden" drawer in the middle of the floating table top which is lined with velvet. 

Now can you imagine the joy you could spread by giving this as a Christmas present? 

If you love this as much as we do, go to our contact page and send us a message and we can arrange collection or a courier.

name: G-Plan "Saddle" Armchair
description:
Beautiful original and untouched 1970s G-Plan "Saddle Arm" Armchair. Wonderful condition, no scratches to the teak or rips to the fabric.

Please do drop us a line to discuss any delivery options. We would prefer a collection but courier delivery can be arranged with price on application.

name: 1970s Mosaic coffee table on metal stand
description:
Beautiful 1970s coffee table with grey tiles and black grouting. Excellent condition and makes a magnificent centre piece. The table is on its original metal centre leg stand which can be unattached for delivery. 

Please enquire about courier delivery. It is very heavy due to its beautiful construction.

name: Original "Roman Holiday" Lobby Card
description:
This item is particularly special and very hard to find. Original "Roman Holiday" lobby card as used in the cinemas at the time the film was released. Great art work with the 3 main characters all perched on the Vespa. Excellent condition and framed ready to hang.

Pleased contact us for costs for delivery within the UK or else collection can be arranged.

name: Original Belgium poster for "Zulu".
description:
A simply magnificent piece of original film artwork for the film "Zulu". This is the original film poster for the film for its release in Belgium. This is the only version to be made with this "wide-screen" layout of the art work. Very rare and framed ready for presentation. Mint condition.

Postage of this item is possible but please contact us for prices dependent on area otherwise collection is possible.

name: Original film poster from "The Italian Job"
description:
An original film poster of the magnificent British film The Italian Job. This particular one is the Italian version that would have graced the walls of the cinemas of Turin itself (or Torino if you are feeling all continental). This is a genuine original and has become quite a rare piece. It is in mint condition and comes framed and ready to hang.

Due to the nature of this item you are more than welcome to come and collect this piece or please do enquire before purchase on specific courier/postage costs for your area.

name: Midwinter Stylecraft tureen from the Marguerite range
description:
This is my absolute favourite! It's just sososoooooo pretty. Erm, yes, sorry. 

So, you are looking at a tureen, a Midwinter Stylecraft one no less, from the gorgeous Marguerite range. The bowl is pink and the lid has the pretty pattern on it. 

As you can see from the second image (at least we hope you can see it), the lid has a small area of wear (little chip) and the bottom of the bowl has a few blemishes which look like they have been there since factory. 

We have two of this (price listed is for one) and both are in equally good but of course pre-loved condition. 

Send us a line if you are interested and we can sort out postage.

name: Midwinter Stylecraft plate Carmen range
description:
Hands up who loves roses? 

Well, we do so it's not surprising that we've included this beautiful Midwinter Stylecraft plate displaying a rose design in our range of vintage tableware. 

The plate is in perfect condition, no chips, no crazing found upon inspection and it's about 25cm in diameter. 

So why always give an actual rose to a loved one? It'll just wither away. This plate won't! 

Please contact us before buying to arrange local collection or get a quote for p&p.

name: Midwinter Marquis of Queensberry soup bowl
description:
A small soup bowl with a black stripe design and two little handles for you to slurp your soup out of. Or to put knickknack in, in case you're not a soup fan. 

The bottom is stamped with "Midwinter, Fine Tableware, Staffordshire England, Shapes designed by the Marquis of Queensberry". 

There are signs of usage inside the bowl (scratches) but no cracks or crazing. 

If you'd like to buy this and live in London, you are welcome to collect it. It would be nice to meet our buyers. 
If you're far far away, please talk to us about p&p. We don't bite :). Promise.

name: Midwinter Stylecraft Rhapsody dish
description:
Another really pretty Midwinter Stylecraft design: a little bonbon dish from the the Rhapsody range. 

A wonderfully calming shade of light blue and painted white flowers, this little dish can serve many purposes. 

Despite its high age, I cannot see any signs of scuffs or cracks but it has some crazing on the underside (see image). 

Please contact us before buying to arrange local collection or get a quote for p&p.

name: Midwinter Queensberry Stripe coffee pot
description:
We are bringing to you some wonderful 1960s style with this coffee pot from renowned manufacturer Midwinter. 

Dating from the early 1960s, it is decorated with a striped period design in olive, grey and black. It was designed by the Marquis of Queensberry. 

This coffee pot is in great condition considering its age. It is free from cracks, chips and crazing, as far as I can see.

Please contact us before buying to arrange local collection or get a quote for p&p. 

Any question, just send Wiggle and More Timer a message and we will be happy to reply as soon as we can.

name: Midwinter Queensberry Stripe coffee cup and saucer
description:
This set contains one coffee cup and one saucer out of the famous Queensberry Stripe set by Midwinter, made in the early 1960s. 

We have 4 sets available. 

Naturally, since all 4 sets are around 50 years old and are pre-used, they show signs of wear and tear. However, there are no serious chips or cracks. 

Please contact us before buying to arrange local collection or get a quote for p&p. 

Any question, just send Wiggle and More Timer a message and we will be happy to reply as soon as we can.

name: Winterling Coffee Pot
description:
Very pretty coffee pot made by Winterling of Bavaria. Elegant design and beautifully understated patterning. Excellent condition with no damage at all.

Drop us a line and we will quote you for delivery.

name: Queen Mary Silver Jubilee mug
description:
Rather a special design, this, we think. This beautiful mug has designs on the front and back. On the front we have portraits of Queen Mary and George V surrounded by flags of the Commonwealth, marking the Silver Jubilee from 1910 - 1935. On the reverse we have the crest surrounded by the names of Commonwealth states. 

It does have crazing but no chips or any other marks. 

A nicely regal and historic way to celebrate this jolly Great Britain of ours.

name: Langley serving platter
description:
Wouldn't you like to serve your cakes or sandwiches on this gorgeous Langley serving platter? Or in true 1970/80s style you could place your vols-au-vent on it as well ;). 

The serving platter is of a soft yellow/green-ish colour with black pattern around the edge. It measures approximately 32 x 16cm and we couldn't find any cracks, chips or crazing. The bottom is stamped with "Langley", the brand's windmill and "England". 

Talk to us about postage or local collection :). We are happy to hear from you.

name: Alfred Meakin Red Sails plate (17cm in diameter)
description:
We have a set of 5 small Alfred Meakin plates from the Red Sails series (1950s/1960s) which are 17cm in diameter and really pretty. 

Two of those plates are in good condition (no crazing, no cracks (one tiny scuff on the rim - see photo 2) but have obvious signs of usage. 

One of them has crazing on the surface (see photo 3). 

Two of them have a few scuffs on the rims, one shows minor crazing, the other more. 

Wiggle and More Timer, as ever, would be more than happy to send further pictures if supplied with an email address. 

Please contact us before buying to arrange local collection or get a quote for p&p.

name: Alfred Meakin Springwood tea pot
description:
Do you like tea? 

Well, we do. Even more so when it's served in a pretty tea pot. Like this one. 

This Alfred Meakin tea pot from the Springwood range stands about 12.5cm tall and is 13cm in diameter at its widest point. It has a pretty pattern of brown and grey leaves, comes with its lid, is in great condition and is bottom stamped with "Alfred Meakin, Springwood, 1978/79".

name: Alfred Meakin Corinth range plate
description:
If you are a big Meakin fan like myself, you will want to get your hands on these, or at least one of them: Plates from the Corinth range by Alfred Meakin. Aren't they beautiful? This design is just so wonderfully 1960s!!!

The plates are 20cm in diameter with no chips, cracks or crazing (we couldn't find any). They are in mint condition, have a lovely pattern in blue, yellow and grey and gilting around the rim. 

We have six of these. The price stated is for one plate. 

As always, come and talk to us if you are interested and we shall organise for the plates to go to a new good home.

name: Crown Devon Cherry Dish
description:
A beautiful piece of Crown Devon tableware. The Cherry Dish. It can be used to serve cherries, olives or anything that tickles your fancy. It could also be displayed just for the sake of it. Perfect condition.

Please drop us a line to arrange postage or collection.

name: Carltonware Crab Dish
description:
Wonderful crab design dish by Carltonware from an Australian design. Wonderful condition and just right to use for that special Sunday high tea occasion.

Please have a chat with us about delivery or collection details and let us know where you would like it sent.

name: Players vintage cigarette box
description:
This is smashing. A lovely very unusual and quite large cigarette box from Players. Date unknown but a real eye catcher to display on the table or have handy in the nice big pocket of your driving jacket. One of the nicest examples we have seen.

Measures 155mm x 110mm

name: GOKO Dual-8 Editor Viewer
description:
Wonderful gadget for the analogue minded among us. This is a spool to spool Super-8 editor and viewer. View your footage and mark it before you take it over to your splicer for the ultimate home movies.

Let us know how you would like to receive it, in person or by the mighty postal service,

name: Hornsea Saffron range - Cup and Saucer
description:
From the same Hornsea Saffron range as the storage jar, we have a set of cup and saucer. 

It's the same brilliantly 1970s design (both cup and saucer are stamped on the bottom giving 1977 as the year of manufacture), lovely brown and orangey shades. 

Cup and saucer are in good condition. We were not able to find any crazing or chips. 

We have 5 of these sets but the price shown is for 1 set. 

If you want to sip your tea or coffee in that true 70s style, drop as a quick line about p&p or local collection.

name: Hornsea storage jar
description:
For all you vintage cookie monsters out there (that's what I'd put into the jar anyway, cooooooookies!) we are showing you a storage jar from the iconic Hornsea Saffron range. It's in warm shades of brown for that extra 1970s feel and it stamped on the bottom. 

Both the actual jar and the wooden lid are in perfect condition with no signs of use or crazing. 

We have two of this but the sale price is for one. 

Since we don't know where you are, please talk to us before committing to buying about p&p or local collection.

name: Studio J & G Meakin serving platter
description:
From the same range as the sugar bowl, the pretty Topic range by J and G Meakin, we bring you a serving platter as well. 

The platter is c. 31cm long and 24cm wide. It has a little chip on the underside (top left in the image) and a spot of crazing. 

I can just see it being used for your next Sunday dinner, carrying the vegetables you so lovingly prepared or - if you are mad about cakes (like me *coughs*) it would present those nicely as well. As always, who am I to tell you what to use it for, though. For all we know, you might want to hang it up on your wall...

Please contact us before buying to arrange local collection or get a quote for p&p.

name: Studio J & G Meakin sugar bowl
description:
This is such a lovely totally retro design - the Topic range from J and G Meakin Studios. The various shades of blue, green and grey are in perfect harmony with each other. And it features a different design on the front and the back (see images). 

This sugar bowl is about 7cm high and 11cm in diameter at the widest point. It's in perfect nick, with no chips or crazing. 

I've fallen in love with this design (it makes me smile when I look at it) so if you can assure me that it will go to a good home, I'm willing to consider letting it go ;). 

Please contact us before buying to arrange local collection or get a quote for p&p.

name: Lord Nelson Ware, Cup and Saucer Set
description:
There is always a debate about which biscuit is best with your morning coffee, well there is in Wiggle and More Timer land anyway. Mr More Timer has a particular penchant for a garibaldi with his but really the big question should be, from which cup do you imbibe your morning tipple? It's not just the bean that gives you that kick and this cup and saucer set is the perfect oracle from which to enjoy your favourite blend.

This is Lord Nelson Ware from Staffordshire in good old Blighty and the design is rather pleasantly called Amanda. Lovely. The set consists of one small coffee cup, perfect for that elevenses treat, and a matching saucer, upon which to balance that all important biscuit based weapon of choice, and we have 6 sets available. There is a rather elegant flower motif inside the cup too. Tese cups and saucers do have a little crazing to them but no actual damage at all.

The cup measures 75mm across and 60mm high. The saucer comes in at a diameter of 120mm.

Please do drop us a line to ask about collection, delivery and possible extra sets.

name: Lord Nelson Ware, Cream Jug and Sugar Bowl Set
description:
A rather elegant elevenses treat here. A Lord Nelson Ware coffee time cream jug and sugar bowl set to really cheer you up in the morning or as a rather sophisticated accompaniment to that last and elusive After Eight mint.

The design is rather daintily called Amanda and each item has a beautiful little flower within. They both measure in at - 70mm in diameter and 45mm high. A rather smashing set I think you will agree. there is a little crazing under the surface but no damage at all. lovely.

Please do drop us a line about delivery, collection or teaming them up with some cups and saucers.

name: Glass tinted Dessert Bowls x 2
description:
We believe these little beauties are from the 1960s but could broach the 1970s, either way they would be great for a mini dinner party whilst watching Abigail's Party on the box. Well, a dinner party for two unless you eat in shifts. This is a set of two matching dishes.

Great condition, no scratches or marks and postage included as long as you are in the UK. For further afield please drop us a line.

name: Drawer shelves
description:
Here is a selection of my reclaimed and customised DRAWER SHELVES. All made from old drawers from chests of drawers with the interiors painted and given a new lease of life. On offer currently are:
The Pink Drawer
The Green Chalk Board Drawer

Prices are per shelf, please specify which you would like.

name: Punk Telephone Table
description: Mix a bit of punk in to your life. Customised yellow, black and pink telephone table. Multiple layers of paint beneath the black so that as it wears and gets knocked it adds new colour.
